message.content:
Doctor: Would you mind confirming your name and date of birth before we get started?|Patient: Kevin Bacon, July 8th, 1958.

Doctor: What brings you into the clinic today?|Patient: I have been having this horrible cough that just won't go away.

Doctor: When did this cough start?|Patient: About a week ago, it really started to get annoying.

Doctor: And were you doing anything when the cough first started?|Patient: No, not really. I was just at work and noticed a tickle in the back of my throat.

Doctor: And then I started coughing and haven't stopped since.|Patient: Okay, and is your cough consistent throughout the day or does it seem to come and go?

Doctor: No, I would say it's consistent throughout the day.|Patient: From the moment I get out of bed in the morning and stop coughing.

Doctor: Does anything seem to make your cough better or worse?|Patient: I did notice that when I was on my morning run on the other day, I began coughing really badly and I had to stop.

Doctor: Okay, so exercise makes it worse. Does anything make it better?|Patient: No, not really.

Doctor: Okay, and is this cough dry or are you coughing up mucus?|Patient: Yeah, every now and then I would cough up some mucus.

Doctor: Okay, any pain or tightness in your chest?|Patient: Yeah, I guess I do feel some tightness in my chest before I cough, but no pain really.

Doctor: And have you been wheezing at all?|Patient: Yes, actually I have noticed that when I lay down to go to bed at night, I start wheezing.

Doctor: Got it. And have you felt short of breath recently?|Patient: No, I wouldn't say short of breath, just the occasional tightness in my chest.

Doctor: Any kind of fever, headache or chills?|Patient: No, that I've noticed.

Doctor: Any fatigue or unintentional weight loss?|Patient: Nope.

Doctor: Okay, any swelling or lumps around your neck or throat?|Patient: Nope.

Doctor: Any recent infections or illnesses?|Patient: No, I would say being in good health lately.

Doctor: Have you ever had a cough like this in the past?|Patient: Um, yeah, I guess when I was a kid, I had asthma and I would get coughs like this once every nine days, but I haven't had it like this in years.

Doctor: Okay, did you receive any kind of treatment?|Patient: Yes, I saw a pulmonologist who gave me some steroids, but I was told I could stop taking them so I did.

Doctor: I see. Let me go ahead and perform a physical exam.|
